TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class WebMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class WebMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

summary.span: 向使用 ASP.NET 创建的 XML Web service 中的某个方法添加此特性后，就可以从远程 Web 客户端调用该方法。

span.span: Adding this attribute to a method within an XML Web service created using ASP.NET makes the method callable from remote Web clients.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在类中具有此属性设置的方法被调用 XML Web 服务方法。Methods within a class that have this attribute set are called XML Web service methods. 方法和类必须是公共且正在运行的 ASP.NET Web 应用程序内。The method and class must be public and running inside an ASP.NET Web application. ## Examples 在下面的方法的示例`GetMachineName`可以远程调用，通过 Web，因为它具有。In the example below the method `GetMachineName` can be remotely called across the Web, because it has a . `GetUserName` 不能进行远程调用，因为它没有，即使它是`public`。`GetUserName` cannot be called remotely, because it does not have a , even though it is `public`.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务调用只能是事务，由于 HTTP 协议的无状态性质的根。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 这意味着，以下两个设置是等效的创建一个新的事务每次调用：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 这还意味着，所有以下设置是等效的;这意味着不支持任何事务：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool enableSession, valuetype System.Web.Services.TransactionOption transactionOption) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务调用只能是事务，由于 HTTP 协议的无状态性质的根。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 这意味着，以下两个设置是等效的创建一个新的事务每次调用：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 这还意味着，所有以下设置是等效的;这意味着不支持任何事务：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

public: property bool BufferResponse { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BufferResponse : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置是否缓存该请求的响应。

span.span: Gets or sets whether the response for this request is buffered.

value.span: 如果缓存该请求的响应，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the response for this request is buffered; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置到`true`，将序列化到内存缓冲区的 XML Web 服务方法的响应，直到完全序列化响应或缓冲区已满。Setting to `true`, serializes the response of the XML Web service method into a memory buffer until either the response is completely serialized or the buffer is full. 一旦缓存的响应，将通过网络将其返回到 XML Web 服务客户端。Once the response is buffered, it is returned to the XML Web service client over the network. 当是`false`，序列化时，对 XML Web 服务方法的响应发送回客户端。When is `false`, the response to the XML Web service method is sent back to the client as it is serialized. 一般情况下，只想要设置到`false`，如果它已知的 XML Web 服务方法，返回到客户端的大量数据。In general, you only want to set to `false`, if it is known that an XML Web service method returns large amounts of data to the client. 对于较少的数据，XML Web 服务性能是更好地与到`true`。For smaller amounts of data, XML Web service performance is better with to `true`. 当是`false`，XML Web 服务方法禁用 SOAP 扩展。When is `false`, SOAP extensions are disabled for the XML Web service method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置属性设置为`false`和处理文本文件返回到客户端的流式处理。The following code example sets the property to `false` and handles the streaming of a text file back to the client. 代码示例演示如何将流式传输的数据返回到客户端使用的类，实现一大段接口。The code example demonstrates how to stream a large piece of data back to the client using a class that implements the interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int CacheDuration { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CacheDuration : int with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置响应应在缓存中保留的秒数。

span.span: Gets or sets the number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 响应应在缓存中保留的秒数。

span.span: The number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 默认值为 0，表示不缓存响应。

span.span: The default is 0, which means the response is not cached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 启用缓存请求和响应都保存在内存中的服务器上至少缓存持续时间因此，必须使用谨慎，如果希望请求或响应是非常大或者您期望差异很大的请求。When caching is enabled requests and responses are held in memory on the server for at least the cache duration so caution must be used if you expect requests or responses to be very large or you expect requests to vary widely. 有两个问题可以影响 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服务应用程序中的输出缓存。There are two issues that can affect output caching in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application. 在 ASP.NET 2.0 中，测试页的 HTTP 方法已从 GET 更改为 POST。In ASP.NET 2.0 the HTTP method of the test page has changed from GET to POST. 但是 POST 通常不进行缓存。However, POSTs are not normally cached. 如果在 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服务应用程序的测试页中改为使用 GET，缓存将正常工作。If you change the test page in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application to use GET, caching works properly. 此外，HTTP 指示用户代理（浏览器或调用应用程序）应该可以通过将“Cache-Control”设置为“no-cache”以重写服务器缓存。In addition, HTTP indicates that a user agent (the browser or calling application) should be able to override server caching by setting the "Cache-Control" to "no-cache". 因此，当 ASP.NET 应用程序找到“no-cache”标头时，会忽略缓存的结果。ASP.NET applications, therefore, ignore cached results when they find a "no-cache" header. ## Examples 下面的示例将调用的结果放置于`ServiceUsage`XML Web 服务方法在缓存中的 60 秒。The following example places the result of the call to the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method in the cache for 60 seconds. 任何时候，只要 XML Web 服务客户端执行`ServiceUsage`这段时间内的 XML Web 服务方法，返回相同的结果。Any time an XML Web service client executes the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method during that time, the same result is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Description : string with get, set

summary.span: 描述 XML Web service 方法的描述性消息。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.

value.span: 描述 XML Web service 方法的描述性消息。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 描述性消息是 XML Web 服务的预期使用者时显示生成的 XML Web 服务的说明文档，如服务说明和服务帮助页。The descriptive message is displayed to prospective consumers of the XML Web service when description documents for the XML Web service are generated, such as the Service Description and the Service help page. ## Examples 在以下示例中，字符串`Obtains the Server Computer Name`用于描述 XML Web 服务在服务说明和服务帮助页中的 XML Web 服务方法。In the example below, the string `Obtains the Server Computer Name` is used to describe the XML Web service method in the Service Description and Service help page for the XML Web service.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableSession { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.EnableSession : bool with get, set

summary.span: 指示是否为 XML Web service 方法启用会话状态。

span.span: Indicates whether session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.

value.span: 如果为 XML Web services 方法启用会话状态，则为 。

span.span: if session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为了在 ASP.NET 中存储会话状态对象，该 XML Web 服务必须继承自和一个应用于 XML Web 服务方法，设置属性设置为`true`。In order to store session state in the ASP.NET object, the XML Web service must inherit from and a applied to the XML Web service method, setting the property to `true`. 如果 XML Web 服务方法不需要会话状态，然后禁用可能会提高性能。If session state is not needed for an XML Web service method, then disabling it may improve performance. 由 XML Web 服务返回的 HTTP cookie 唯一标识的 XML Web 服务客户端。An XML Web service client is uniquely identified by an HTTP cookie returned by an XML Web service. 为了使 XML Web 服务来维持会话状态的客户端，客户端必须保存 cookie。In order for an XML Web service to maintain session state for a client, the client must persist the cookie. 客户端可以通过创建的新实例接收的 HTTP cookie并将分配给之前调用 XML Web 服务方法的代理类的属性。Clients can receive the HTTP cookie by creating a new instance of and assigning that to the property of the proxy class before calling the XML Web service method. 如果需要来维持会话状态之外，代理类实例超出范围时，客户端必须保存到 XML Web 服务调用之间的 HTTP cookie。If you need to maintain session state beyond when the proxy class instance goes out of scope, the client must persist the HTTP cookie between calls to the XML Web service. 例如，Web 窗体客户端可以通过保存保留的 HTTP cookie在其自己的会话状态中。For instance, a Web Forms client can persist the HTTP cookie by saving the in its own session state. 因为并非所有的 XML Web services 使用会话状态，因此要求客户端不始终使用的客户端代理属性，该 XML Web 服务的文档应说明是否使用会话状态。Because not all XML Web services use session state and thus clients are not always required to use the property of a client proxy, the documentation for the XML Web service should state whether session state is used. ## Examples 使用会话状态，以确定特定会话的次数下面的示例中访问 XML Web 服务方法`SessionHitCounter`。The example below uses session state to determine how many times a particular session accesses the XML Web service method `SessionHitCounter`. 下面的代码示例是使用会话状态的 XML Web 服务的 Web 窗体客户端。The following code example is a Web Forms client of an XML Web service that uses session state. 客户端仍然存在唯一标识的会话通过将其存储在客户端的会话状态中的 HTTP cookie。The client persists the HTTP cookie that uniquely identifies the session by storing it in the client's session state. [!code-aspx-csharp[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/CS/serverusageclientcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/VB/serverusageclientvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MessageName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MessageName : string with get, set

summary.span: 在传递到 XML Web service 方法和从 XML Web service 方法返回的数据中用于 XML Web service 方法的名称。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and returned from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 在传递到 XML Web services 方法和从 XML Web services 方法返回的数据中用于 XML Web services 方法的名称。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 默认值是 XML Web services 方法的名称。

span.span: The default is the name of the XML Web service method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可用于别名方法或属性的名称。The property can be used to alias method or property names. 最常用的将属性来唯一标识多态方法。The most common use of the property will be to uniquely identify polymorphic methods. 默认情况下，设置为 XML Web 服务方法的名称。By default, is set to the name of the XML Web service method. 因此，如果 XML Web 服务包含具有相同名称的两个或多个 XML Web 服务方法，您可以通过唯一地标识单个 XML Web 服务方法设置为在 XML Web 服务，而无需更改的名称中是唯一的名称在代码中的实际方法名称。Therefore, if an XML Web service contains two or more XML Web service methods with the same name, you can uniquely identify the individual XML Web service methods by setting the to a name unique within the XML Web service, without changing the name of the actual method name in code. 当数据传递给 XML Web 服务发送请求并返回在响应中发送。When data is passed to an XML Web service it is sent in a request and when it is returned it is sent in a response. 在请求和响应，用于 XML Web 服务方法的名称是其属性。Within the request and response, the name used for the XML Web service method is its property. 与 XML Web 服务方法关联的消息名称必须是 XML Web 服务中唯一的。The message name associated with an XML Web service method must be unique within the XML Web service. 如果客户端将调用原始方法的后面，添加具有相同名称但不同的参数的新 XML Web 服务方法，应为新的方法指定不同的消息名称，但应保留原始消息名称，为是为了确保兼容性与现有客户端。If a new XML Web serivce method with the same name but different parameters is added after clients are calling the original method, a different message name should be specified for the new method but the original message name should be left as is to ensure compatability with existing clients. ## Examples 在以下示例中，用来区分这两个`Add`方法。In the example below, is used to disambiguate the two `Add` methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption TransactionOption { System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption value); };

summary.span: 指示 XML Web service 方法的事务支持。

span.span: Indicates the transaction support of an XML Web service method.

value.span: XML Web services 方法的事务支持。

span.span: The transaction support of an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks 仅在事务中，由于 HTTP 协议的无状态性质的根对象作为加入 XML Web 服务方法。XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 如果 COM 对象被标记为组件服务管理工具中的事务中运行，可以调用 XML Web 服务方法参与作为 XML Web 服务方法，在同一事务中的 COM 对象。XML Web service methods can invoke COM objects that participate in the same transaction as the XML Web service method, if the COM object is marked to run within a transaction in the Component Services administrative tool. 如果使用 XML Web 服务方法的属性`Required`或`RequiresNew`调用另一种 XML Web 服务方法与属性`Required`或`RequiresNew`，每个 XML Web 服务方法参与其自身事务，因为 XML Web 服务方法只能作为一个事务中的根对象。If an XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew` invokes another XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew`, each XML Web service method participates in its own transaction, because an XML Web service method can only act as the root object in a transaction. |项Item|描述Description| |----------|-----------------| |已禁用Disabled|指示 XML Web 服务方法不会在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 当处理请求时，而无需事务执行 XML Web 服务方法。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Disabled`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Disabled`)]| |NotSupportedNotSupported|指示 XML Web 服务方法不会在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 当处理请求时，而无需事务执行 XML Web 服务方法。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.NotSupported`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.NotSupported`)]| |支持Supported|指示 XML Web 服务方法不会在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of transactions. 处理请求时，不包含事务创建 XML Web 服务。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Supported`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Supported`)]| |必需Required|指示 XML Web 服务方法需要事务。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a transaction. 由于 XML Web 服务方法只能作为一个事务中的根对象加入，XML Web 服务方法将创建一个新的事务。Since XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, a new transaction will be created for the XML Web service method.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Required`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Required`)]| |RequiresNewRequiresNew|指示 XML Web 服务方法需要一个新的事务。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a new transaction. 处理请求时，新的事务中创建 XML Web 服务。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created within a new transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`)]| 如果从引发或由 XML Web 服务方法未捕获异常，会自动中止事务。If an exception is thrown from or not caught by an XML Web service method, the transaction is automatically aborted. 如果未发生异常，除非显式调用该方法，将自动提交事务`SetAbort`。If no exceptions occur the transaction is automatically committed unless the method explicitly calls `SetAbort`. ## Examples 下面的示例开始新事务时`Transfer`调用方法。The example below begins a new transaction when the `Transfer` method is called.
